item.title: Change Replication Filter
item.description: CHANGE REPLICATION FILTER sets one or more replication filtering rules on the slave in the same way as starting the slave mysqld with replication filtering options such as –replicate-do-db or –replicate-wild-ignore-table. Unlike the case with the server options, this statement does not require restarting the server to take effect, only that the slave SQL thread be stopped using STOP SLAVE SQL_THREAD first (and restarted with START SLAVE SQL_THREAD afterwards). CHANGE REPLICATION FILTER requires the REPLICATION_SLAVE_ADMIN or SUPER privilege. Use the FOR CHANNEL channel clause to make a replication filter specific to a replication channel, for example on a multi-source replication slave. Filters applied without a specific FOR CHANNEL clause are considered global filters, meaning that they are applied to all replication channels.
